text: Hi Everyone, does anybody have an idea if you can utilize a clone call for Line items API? We need to emulate the same behaviour API wise, that the UI does when creating a new quote, cloning the line items on to the quote and again back to the deal when publishing. Anybody has any experience working with this?

hey george!  apologies for late response.  just getting back from holiday
I looked at the ticket and an agent asked some follow up questions that you must have missed…

Hi all,

Is it possible to fetch the contact's attachments via API and display them in the user interface?

Short flow:

Users will be able to log in to a private site, and then based on contact I want to show their files.

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.

Yes, you get the attachment IDs through engagement APIs and then you can the file URL by calling files APIs
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/notes>

Get signed URL to access private file.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/files/files>
you would need to use the engagements api to get and filter by attachments, then get signed url links files/signed irl api that make them accessible for a period of time.
But that is to make a patch, I was using it and they told me that it was better because of the id
Yeah you can use the idProperty on any of the methods (Patch, Post, Get, etc)
If you use an email that isn't valid it will let you know
<@U012DQVJY9F>, <@U25PYL3Q8> thanks for the help could send me an example? I don't see how I can "connect" the id of the user with their files
I tried it with postman and it didn't work, it worked for me to search for the email in the following way

url/contacts/search
method: POST
`{`
      `filterGroups: [`
        `{`
          `filters: [`
            `{`
              `propertyName: "email",`
              `operator: "EQ",`
              `value: email,`
            `},`
          `],`
        `},`
      `],`
    `}`
Can you share the URL of the failed request?
It should look like this: GET <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/nerds@gmaill.com?idProperty=email>
<mailto:nerds@gmail.com|nerds@gmail.com> being the email address
It is exactly the one you shared, at the time I did a GET to search for the email it did not work, so I used it for the moment only to make a

With CBE being limited on passing information to contacts/workflows/emails, would running what would be a CBE as a Custom Object instead have any problems? For us, if a contact watched/downloaded a piece of content it would create a new record and then associate to the contact w/ all of the information on that asset. We'd hit association limits after about ~2-3 years, but that's the only limitation I can see.

Hey Colton—cbe PM here—what limitations are you referring to? CBEs are available as workflow triggers and delay until, they also can be associated with companies deals and tickets in addition to contacts
I will say that using objects for what should really be events, in addition to hitting object limits, would prevent you from using this data in places like attribution reporting and journey analytics
Very interesting, and if you hit the same get contact api with the id that relates to the email what happens?
Also what error and error code is returned?

<@U05PNE9896C> limitations in regards to what information can be passed down from a CBE. Here's a simplified use case:

We have ~50,000 downloadable assets available under subscription. When someone downloads an asset they then get an email. That email is then populated from the properties of that record (CBE or Custom Obj), those properties being name, category, img src.

This is relatively simple to do in a custom object, but seemed like possibly CBE was the proper use case but wasn't sure.

Problem really comes in at scale w/ 50,000 unique assets to track and ~10k unique downloads a day.

Thanks for the response btw! I know CBE is still being expanded in some ways.
haha you beat me to it
you would need to get the contact ids or look them up by email using the contact api

search api has a much smaller limit. if you are using search that may be it. those portals may also be doing quite a bit more api calls elsewhere. generally with this error you would create some error handling and push this to a queue or something similar. off load it to a background function that has more time to execute, etc
can you confirm if that was the correct answer or if it was something else? someone searching in the future would see this and not know what to do

i’d try manually testing this in postman and verify that it is set up correctly. you likely have some configuration incorrect in your api call. without details on what you are sending there isn’t much we can do to replicate the issue
a good way to figure this out is to set up a property how you want it, and then look it up via the api. this will allow you to get the properties and the correct values you are looking for
you api credentials are incorrect.
sounds like your code is not setup correctly try following an example and then once you have it set up correctly, mimic that with your call
you would likely need to get the line items there, then copy that and create a new line item

the default properties are auto sent based upon the cookied user. a good way to test is to set up one of these and testing it out a few times to make it trigger, then you would review the items in the reporting/ behavioral events UI. sometimes there is a bit of a delay so run a few and then come back later to check

when you subscribe to a webhook for an object update, any updates will trigger it. 

if you were using custom coded workflows you could build the trigger, but webhooks are a bit different

Hi all! I have a integration with an `external website`, I wrote some javascript code and I uploaded to the `HubSpot Files`, but when I have a lot of traffic on that external website the Javascript code is not working correctly, does somebody know if is it ok to use `HubSpot as CDN` or it's better if I change the CDN to `cloudflare (example)`? Thanks
